meanings.sent1: The steam turned into water because it was condensable.
meanings.sent2: The scientist used a condensable material to create a smaller version of the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The clouds looked like condensable cotton candy in the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts were so condensable, she could hardly contain them.
meanings.sent5: The fog was a condensable blanket over the city, hiding everything from view.

meanings.definition: Capable of being made more compact or dense.
meanings.sent1: The foam mattress was condensable, allowing it to be rolled up for storage.
meanings.sent2: The snow became more condensable as the temperature dropped, turning into ice.
meanings.sent3: The suitcase was so condensable that she could fit all her clothes in it easily.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were condensable, making them easier to understand and remember.
meanings.sent5: The dough was condensable, allowing the baker to shape it into different forms.
